title: Digital Source Type
description: Classification of AI involvement in content creation, aligned with IPTC digitalsourcetype vocabulary. Used in provenance metadata to declare how a creative asset, artifact, or individual asset was produced.

enumDescriptions.digital_capture: Captured by a digital device (camera, scanner, screen recording) with no AI involvement
enumDescriptions.digital_creation: Created by a human using digital tools (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects) without AI generation
enumDescriptions.trained_algorithmic_media: Generated entirely by a trained AI model (DALL-E, Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, Sora)
enumDescriptions.composite_with_trained_algorithmic_media: Human-created content combined with AI-generated elements (e.g., photo with AI background)
enumDescriptions.algorithmic_media: Produced by deterministic algorithms without machine learning (procedural generation, rule-based systems)
enumDescriptions.composite_capture: Multiple digital captures composited together without AI
enumDescriptions.composite_synthetic: Composite of multiple elements where at least one is AI-generated (e.g., stock photo composited with AI-generated background)
enumDescriptions.human_edits: Content augmented, corrected, or enhanced by humans using non-generative tools
enumDescriptions.data_driven_media: Assembled from structured data feeds (DCO templates, product catalogs, weather-triggered variants)
